name: Mexican-Style Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color), tops cut off and seeds removed
1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes with green chilies
steps:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Cut the tops off bell peppers and remove all seeds and membranes. Set peppers upright in the baking dish.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add diced onion and cook for 4-5 minutes until translucent.
Add minced garlic and diced jalapeño, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add black beans, corn, diced tomatoes with green chilies, cumin, chili powder, and smoked paprika.
Cook for 3-4 minutes until heated through.
Remove from heat and stir in cooked rice, half of the cheese, cilantro, and lime juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon the filling mixture into each bell pepper, packing it down gently.
Top each pepper with remaining shredded cheese.
Pour 1/2 cup of water into the bottom of the baking dish around the peppers.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes until peppers are tender and cheese is golden brown.
Let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve hot with optional sour cream on the side.
